column2: Lymphocyte-driven immune-cell signatures correspond to clinical phenotypes in Autoimmune Limbic Encephalitis

The dataset contains multidimensional flow cytometry (mFC) data from the peripheral blood (PB) and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) of 640 patients (81 Autoimmune Limbic Encephalitis (ALE), 148 relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS), 197 Alzheimer's disease (AD), 67 frontotemporal dementia (FTD), 37 temporal lobe epilepsy with hippocampal sclerosis (TLE-HS), and 110 somatic symptom disorder (SD) patients). Furthermore, clinical and paraclinical data are available for the ALE cohort (neuropsychological performance, abnormalities on electroencephalography (EEG) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)).
